FuncDef:
The queue random-discard command configures the random discard value for an FQ.
The undo queue random-discard command cancels the configuration.
By default, no random discard value is configured for an FQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the FQ priority.
The value can be EF, AF1, AF2, AF3, AF4, BE, CS6, or CS7.

Specifies the percentage based on which traffic is randomly discarded.
The value ranges from 0.1 to 5, in percentage.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure the random discard value for an FQ, run the queue random-discard command.
Precautions
VE and global-VE interfaces do not support this function. When a flow queue configured with this command is applied to VE or global-VE interfaces, this command does not take effect. If the qos schedule-tree distribute-mode outbound command is run on an interface, the command does not take effect on the interface.
The P51-E/P101-E/LPUI-51-E subcards do not support this function. When a flow queue configured with this command is applied to these subcards, this command does not take effect.
